signature: apoc.algo.cover(nodes :: ANY) :: (rel :: RELATIONSHIP)
name: apoc.algo.cover
description: Returns all `RELATIONSHIP` values connecting the given set of `NODE` values.

returnDescription.name: rel
returnDescription.description: The relationships connected to the given nodes.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to look for connected relationships on.

signature: apoc.case(conditionals :: LIST<ANY>, elseQuery =  :: STRING, params = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.case
description: For each pair of conditional and read-only queries in the given `LIST<ANY>`, this procedure will run the first query for which the conditional is evaluated to true. If none of the conditionals are true, the `ELSE` query will run instead.

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: The result returned from the evaluated Cypher query.

argumentDescription.name: conditionals
argumentDescription.description: A list of conditionals, where each conditional is a pair: the first element is a predicate, and the second is a Cypher query to be executed based on that predicate.

argumentDescription.name: elseQuery
argumentDescription.description: A Cypher query to evaluate if all conditionals evaluate to false.

argumentDescription.name: params
argumentDescription.description: A map of parameters to be used in the executed Cypher query.

signature: apoc.coll.pairWithOffset(coll :: LIST<ANY>, offset :: INTEGER) :: (value :: LIST<ANY>)
name: apoc.coll.pairWithOffset
description: Returns a `LIST<ANY>` of pairs defined by the offset.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to create pairs from.

argumentDescription.name: offset
argumentDescription.description: The offset to make each pair with from the given list.

signature: apoc.coll.partition(coll :: LIST<ANY>, batchSize :: INTEGER) :: (value :: LIST<ANY>)
name: apoc.coll.partition
description:
Partitions the original `LIST<ANY>` into a new `LIST<ANY>` of the given batch size.
The final `LIST<ANY>` may be smaller than the given batch size.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to partition into smaller sublists.

argumentDescription.name: batchSize
argumentDescription.description: The max size of each partitioned sublist.

signature: apoc.coll.zipToRows(list1 :: LIST<ANY>, list2 :: LIST<ANY>) :: (value :: LIST<ANY>)
name: apoc.coll.zipToRows
description: Returns the two `LIST<ANY>` values zipped together, with one row per zipped pair.

argumentDescription.name: list1
argumentDescription.description: The list to zip together with `list2`.

argumentDescription.name: list2
argumentDescription.description: The list to zip together with `list1`.

signature: apoc.convert.toTree(paths :: LIST<PATH>, lowerCaseRels = true :: BOOLEAN, config = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.convert.toTree
description: Returns a stream of `MAP` values, representing the given `PATH` values as a tree with at least one root.

argumentDescription.name: paths
argumentDescription.description: A list of paths to convert into a tree.

argumentDescription.name: lowerCaseRels
argumentDescription.description: Whether or not to convert relationship types to lower case.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: { nodes = {} :: MAP, rels = {} :: MAP, sortPaths = true :: BOOLEAN }

signature: apoc.create.addLabels(nodes :: ANY, labels :: LIST<STRING>) :: (node :: NODE)
name: apoc.create.addLabels
description: Adds the given labels to the given `NODE` values.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to add labels to.

argumentDescription.name: labels
argumentDescription.description: The labels to add to the nodes.

signature: apoc.create.node(labels :: LIST<STRING>, props :: MAP) :: (node :: NODE)
name: apoc.create.node
description: Creates a `NODE` with the given dynamic labels.

argumentDescription.name: labels
argumentDescription.description: The labels to assign to the new node.

argumentDescription.name: props
argumentDescription.description: The properties to assign to the new node.

signature: apoc.create.nodes(labels :: LIST<STRING>, props :: LIST<MAP>) :: (node :: NODE)
name: apoc.create.nodes
description: Creates `NODE` values with the given dynamic labels.

argumentDescription.name: labels
argumentDescription.description: The labels to assign to the new nodes.

argumentDescription.name: props
argumentDescription.description: The properties to assign to the new nodes.

signature: apoc.create.relationship(from :: NODE, relType :: STRING, props :: MAP, to :: NODE) :: (rel :: RELATIONSHIP)
name: apoc.create.relationship
description: Creates a `RELATIONSHIP` with the given dynamic relationship type.

argumentDescription.name: from
argumentDescription.description: The node from which the outgoing relationship will start.

argumentDescription.name: relType
argumentDescription.description: The type to assign to the new relationship.

argumentDescription.name: props
argumentDescription.description: The properties to assign to the new relationship.

argumentDescription.name: to
argumentDescription.description: The node to which the incoming relationship will be connected.

signature: apoc.create.removeLabels(nodes :: ANY, labels :: LIST<STRING>) :: (node :: NODE)
name: apoc.create.removeLabels
description: Removes the given labels from the given `NODE` values.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The node to remove labels from.

argumentDescription.name: labels
argumentDescription.description: The labels to remove from the given node.

signature: apoc.create.removeProperties(nodes :: ANY, keys :: LIST<STRING>) :: (node :: NODE)
name: apoc.create.removeProperties
description: Removes the given properties from the given `NODE` values.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to remove properties from.

argumentDescription.name: keys
argumentDescription.description: The property keys to remove from the given nodes.

signature: apoc.create.removeRelProperties(rels :: ANY, keys :: LIST<STRING>) :: (rel :: RELATIONSHIP)
name: apoc.create.removeRelProperties
description: Removes the given properties from the given `RELATIONSHIP` values.

argumentDescription.name: rels
argumentDescription.description: The relationships to remove properties from.

argumentDescription.name: keys
argumentDescription.description: The property keys to remove from the given nodes.

signature: apoc.create.setLabels(nodes :: ANY, labels :: LIST<STRING>) :: (node :: NODE)
name: apoc.create.setLabels
description: Sets the given labels to the given `NODE` values. Non-matching labels are removed from the nodes.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to set labels on.

argumentDescription.name: labels
argumentDescription.description: The labels to set on the given nodes.

signature: apoc.create.setProperties(nodes :: ANY, keys :: LIST<STRING>, values :: LIST<ANY>) :: (node :: NODE)
name: apoc.create.setProperties
description: Sets the given properties to the given `NODE` values.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to set properties on.

argumentDescription.name: keys
argumentDescription.description: The property keys to set on the given nodes.

argumentDescription.name: values
argumentDescription.description: The values to assign to the properties on the given nodes.

signature: apoc.create.setProperty(nodes :: ANY, key :: STRING, value :: ANY) :: (node :: NODE)
name: apoc.create.setProperty
description: Sets the given property to the given `NODE` values.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to set a property on.

argumentDescription.name: key
argumentDescription.description: The name of the property key to set.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value of the property to set.

signature: apoc.create.setRelProperties(rels :: ANY, keys :: LIST<STRING>, values :: LIST<ANY>) :: (rel :: RELATIONSHIP)
name: apoc.create.setRelProperties
description: Sets the given properties on the `RELATIONSHIP` values.

argumentDescription.name: rels
argumentDescription.description: The relationships to set properties on.

argumentDescription.name: keys
argumentDescription.description: The keys of the properties to set on the given relationships.

argumentDescription.name: values
argumentDescription.description: The values of the properties to set on the given relationships.

signature: apoc.create.setRelProperty(rels :: ANY, key :: STRING, value :: ANY) :: (rel :: RELATIONSHIP)
name: apoc.create.setRelProperty
description: Sets the given property on the `RELATIONSHIP` values.

argumentDescription.name: rels
argumentDescription.description: The relationships to set a property on.

argumentDescription.name: key
argumentDescription.description: The name of the property key to set.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value of the property to set.

signature: apoc.create.uuids(count :: INTEGER) :: (row :: INTEGER, uuid :: STRING)
name: apoc.create.uuids
description: Returns a stream of UUIDs.

returnDescription.name: row
returnDescription.description: The row number of the generated UUID.

deprecatedBy: Neo4j's randomUUID() function can be used as a replacement, for example: `UNWIND range(0,$count) AS row RETURN row, randomUUID() AS uuid`

argumentDescription.name: count
argumentDescription.description: The number of UUID values to generate.

signature: apoc.cypher.runTimeboxed(statement :: STRING, params :: MAP, timeout :: INTEGER) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.cypher.runTimeboxed
description: Terminates a Cypher statement if it has not finished before the set timeout (ms).

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: The result returned from the Cypher statement.

argumentDescription.name: statement
argumentDescription.description: The Cypher statement to run.

argumentDescription.name: params
argumentDescription.description: The parameters for the given Cypher statement.

argumentDescription.name: timeout
argumentDescription.description: The maximum time, in milliseconds, the statement can run for.

signature: apoc.do.case(conditionals :: LIST<ANY>, elseQuery =  :: STRING, params = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.do.case
description:
For each pair of conditional queries in the given `LIST<ANY>`, this procedure will run the first query for which the conditional is evaluated to true.
If none of the conditionals are true, the `ELSE` query will run instead.

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: The result returned from the evaluated Cypher query.

argumentDescription.name: conditionals
argumentDescription.description: A list of conditionals, where each conditional is a pair: the first element is a predicate, and the second is a Cypher query to be executed based on that predicate.

argumentDescription.name: elseQuery
argumentDescription.description: A Cypher query to evaluate if all conditionals evaluate to false.

argumentDescription.name: params
argumentDescription.description: A map of parameters to be used in the executed Cypher query.

signature: apoc.do.when(condition :: BOOLEAN, ifQuery :: STRING, elseQuery :: STRING, params = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.do.when
description: Runs the given read/write `ifQuery` if the conditional has evaluated to true, otherwise the `elseQuery` will run.

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: The result returned from the evaluated Cypher query.

argumentDescription.name: condition
argumentDescription.description: The predicate that determines whether to execute the `ifQuery`.

argumentDescription.name: ifQuery
argumentDescription.description: The Cypher statement to run if the condition is true.

argumentDescription.name: elseQuery
argumentDescription.description: The Cypher statement to run if the condition is false.

argumentDescription.name: params
argumentDescription.description: The parameters for the given Cypher statement.

signature: apoc.export.arrow.all(file :: STRING, config = {} :: MAP) :: (file :: STRING, source :: STRING, format :: STRING, nodes :: INTEGER, relationships :: INTEGER, properties :: INTEGER, time :: INTEGER, rows :: INTEGER, batchSize :: INTEGER, batches :: INTEGER, done :: BOOLEAN, data :: ANY)
name: apoc.export.arrow.all
description: Exports the full database as an arrow file.

returnDescription.name: file
returnDescription.description: The name of the file to which the data was exported.

returnDescription.name: source
returnDescription.description: A summary of the exported data.

returnDescription.name: format
returnDescription.description: The format the file is exported in.

returnDescription.name: batchSize
returnDescription.description: The size of the batches the export was run in.

returnDescription.name: batches
returnDescription.description: The number of batches the export was run in.

returnDescription.name: data
returnDescription.description: The data returned by the export.

deprecatedBy: This procedure is being moved to APOC Extended.

argumentDescription.name: file
argumentDescription.description: The name of the file to export the data to.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: { batchSize = 2000 :: INTEGER }

signature: apoc.export.arrow.graph(file :: STRING, graph :: ANY, config = {} :: MAP) :: (file :: STRING, source :: STRING, format :: STRING, nodes :: INTEGER, relationships :: INTEGER, properties :: INTEGER, time :: INTEGER, rows :: INTEGER, batchSize :: INTEGER, batches :: INTEGER, done :: BOOLEAN, data :: ANY)
name: apoc.export.arrow.graph
description: Exports the given graph as an arrow file.

returnDescription.name: file
returnDescription.description: The name of the file to which the data was exported.

returnDescription.name: source
returnDescription.description: A summary of the exported data.

returnDescription.name: format
returnDescription.description: The format the file is exported in.

returnDescription.name: batchSize
returnDescription.description: The size of the batches the export was run in.

returnDescription.name: batches
returnDescription.description: The number of batches the export was run in.

returnDescription.name: data
returnDescription.description: The data returned by the export.

deprecatedBy: This procedure is being moved to APOC Extended.

argumentDescription.name: file
argumentDescription.description: The name of the file to export the data to.

argumentDescription.name: graph
argumentDescription.description: The graph to export.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: { batchSize = 2000 :: INTEGER }

signature: apoc.export.arrow.query(file :: STRING, query :: STRING, config = {} :: MAP) :: (file :: STRING, source :: STRING, format :: STRING, nodes :: INTEGER, relationships :: INTEGER, properties :: INTEGER, time :: INTEGER, rows :: INTEGER, batchSize :: INTEGER, batches :: INTEGER, done :: BOOLEAN, data :: ANY)
name: apoc.export.arrow.query
description: Exports the results from the given Cypher query as an arrow file.

returnDescription.name: file
returnDescription.description: The name of the file to which the data was exported.

returnDescription.name: source
returnDescription.description: A summary of the exported data.

returnDescription.name: format
returnDescription.description: The format the file is exported in.

returnDescription.name: batchSize
returnDescription.description: The size of the batches the export was run in.

returnDescription.name: batches
returnDescription.description: The number of batches the export was run in.

returnDescription.name: data
returnDescription.description: The data returned by the export.

deprecatedBy: This procedure is being moved to APOC Extended.

argumentDescription.name: file
argumentDescription.description: The name of the file to which the data will be exported.

argumentDescription.name: query
argumentDescription.description: The query to use to collect the data for export.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: { batchSize = 2000 :: INTEGER }

signature: apoc.export.arrow.stream.all(config = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: BYTEARRAY)
name: apoc.export.arrow.stream.all
description: Exports the full database as an arrow byte array.
deprecatedBy: This procedure is being moved to APOC Extended.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: { batchSize = 2000 :: INTEGER }

signature: apoc.export.arrow.stream.graph(graph :: ANY, config = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: BYTEARRAY)
name: apoc.export.arrow.stream.graph
description: Exports the given graph as an arrow byte array.
deprecatedBy: This procedure is being moved to APOC Extended.

argumentDescription.name: graph
argumentDescription.description: The graph to export.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: { batchSize = 2000 :: INTEGER }

signature: apoc.export.arrow.stream.query(query :: STRING, config = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: BYTEARRAY)
name: apoc.export.arrow.stream.query
description: Exports the given Cypher query as an arrow byte array.
deprecatedBy: This procedure is being moved to APOC Extended.

argumentDescription.name: query
argumentDescription.description: The query used to collect the data for export.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: { batchSize = 2000 :: INTEGER }

signature: apoc.load.arrow(file :: STRING, config = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.load.arrow
description: Imports `NODE` and `RELATIONSHIP` values from the provided arrow file.

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: A map of data loaded from the given file.

deprecatedBy: This procedure is being moved to APOC Extended.

argumentDescription.name: file
argumentDescription.description: The name of the file to import data from.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: This value is never used.

signature: apoc.load.arrow.stream(source :: BYTEARRAY, config = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.load.arrow.stream
description: Imports `NODE` and `RELATIONSHIP` values from the provided arrow byte array.

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: A map of data loaded from the given file.

deprecatedBy: This procedure is being moved to APOC Extended.

argumentDescription.name: source
argumentDescription.description: The data to load.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: This value is never used.

signature: apoc.load.jsonParams(urlOrKeyOrBinary :: ANY, headers :: MAP, payload :: STRING, path =  :: STRING, config = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.load.jsonParams
description:
Loads a JSON document from a URL (e.g. web-API) as a stream of values if the given JSON document is a `LIST<ANY>`.
If the given JSON file is a `MAP`, this procedure imports a single value instead.

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: A map of data loaded from the given file.

deprecatedBy: This procedure is being moved to APOC Extended.

argumentDescription.name: urlOrKeyOrBinary
argumentDescription.description: The name of the file or binary data to import the data from. Note that a URL needs to be properly encoded to conform with the URI standard.

argumentDescription.name: headers
argumentDescription.description: Headers to be used when connecting to the given URL.

argumentDescription.name: payload
argumentDescription.description: The payload to send when connecting to the given URL.

argumentDescription.name: path
argumentDescription.description: A JSON path expression used to extract specific subparts of the JSON document (extracted by a link:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSONPath[JSONPath] expression). The default is: ``.

argumentDescription.name: config

signature: apoc.log.stream(path :: STRING, config = {} :: MAP) :: (lineNo :: INTEGER, line :: STRING, path :: STRING)
name: apoc.log.stream
description:
Returns the file contents from the given log, optionally returning only the last n lines.
This procedure requires users to have an admin role.

returnDescription.name: path
returnDescription.description: The path to the log file.

deprecatedBy: This procedure is being moved to APOC Extended.

argumentDescription.name: path
argumentDescription.description: The name of the log file to read.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: { last :: INTEGER }

signature: apoc.nodes.delete(nodes :: ANY, batchSize :: INTEGER) :: (value :: INTEGER)
name: apoc.nodes.delete
description: Deletes all `NODE` values with the given ids.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to be deleted. Nodes can be of type `STRING` (elementId()), `INTEGER` (id()), `NODE`, or `LIST<STRING | INTEGER | NODE>`.

argumentDescription.name: batchSize
argumentDescription.description: The number of node values to delete in a single batch.

signature: apoc.refactor.categorize(sourceKey :: STRING, type :: STRING, outgoing :: BOOLEAN, label :: STRING, targetKey :: STRING, copiedKeys :: LIST<STRING>, batchSize :: INTEGER)
name: apoc.refactor.categorize
description:
Creates new category `NODE` values from `NODE` values in the graph with the specified `sourceKey` as one of its property keys.
The new category `NODE` values are then connected to the original `NODE` values with a `RELATIONSHIP` of the given type.

argumentDescription.name: sourceKey
argumentDescription.description: The property key to add to the on the new node.

argumentDescription.name: type
argumentDescription.description: The relationship type to connect to the new node.

argumentDescription.name: outgoing
argumentDescription.description: Whether the relationship should be outgoing or not.

argumentDescription.name: label
argumentDescription.description: The label of the new node.

argumentDescription.name: targetKey
argumentDescription.description: The name by which the source key value will be referenced on the new node.

argumentDescription.name: copiedKeys
argumentDescription.description: A list of additional property keys to be copied to the new node.

argumentDescription.name: batchSize
argumentDescription.description: The max size of each batch.

signature: apoc.refactor.deleteAndReconnect(path :: PATH, nodes :: LIST<NODE>, config = {} :: MAP) :: (nodes :: LIST<NODE>, relationships :: LIST<RELATIONSHIP>)
name: apoc.refactor.deleteAndReconnect
description:
Removes the given `NODE` values from the `PATH` (and graph, including all of its relationships) and reconnects the remaining `NODE` values.
Note, undefined behaviour for paths that visits the same node multiple times.
Note, nodes that are not connected in the same direction as the path will not be reconnected, for example `MATCH p=(:A)-->(b:B)<--(:C) CALL apoc.refactor.deleteAndReconnect(p, [b]) ...` will not reconnect the :A and :C nodes.

argumentDescription.name: path
argumentDescription.description: The path containing the nodes to delete and the remaining nodes to reconnect.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to delete.

argumentDescription.name: config

signature: apoc.refactor.rename.label(oldLabel :: STRING, newLabel :: STRING, nodes = [] :: LIST<NODE>) :: (batches :: INTEGER, total :: INTEGER, timeTaken :: INTEGER, committedOperations :: INTEGER, failedOperations :: INTEGER, failedBatches :: INTEGER, retries :: INTEGER, errorMessages :: MAP, batch :: MAP, operations :: MAP, constraints :: LIST<STRING>, indexes :: LIST<STRING>)
name: apoc.refactor.rename.label
description:
Renames the given label from `oldLabel` to `newLabel` for all `NODE` values.
If a `LIST<NODE>` is provided, the renaming is applied to the `NODE` values within this `LIST<NODE>` only.

returnDescription.name: batches
returnDescription.description: The number of batches the operation was run in.

returnDescription.name: total
returnDescription.description: The total number of renamings performed.

returnDescription.name: timeTaken
returnDescription.description: The time taken to complete the operation.

returnDescription.name: committedOperations
returnDescription.description: The total number of committed operations.

returnDescription.name: failedOperations
returnDescription.description: The total number of failed operations.

returnDescription.name: failedBatches
returnDescription.description: The total number of failed batches.

returnDescription.name: batch
operations
constraints
returnDescription.description: Constraints associated with the given label or type.

returnDescription.name: indexes
returnDescription.description: Indexes associated with the given label or type.

argumentDescription.name: oldLabel
argumentDescription.description: The label to rename.

argumentDescription.name: newLabel
argumentDescription.description: The new name to give the label.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to apply the new name to. If this list is empty, all nodes with the old label will be renamed.

signature: apoc.refactor.rename.type(oldType :: STRING, newType :: STRING, rels = [] :: LIST<RELATIONSHIP>, config = {} :: MAP) :: (batches :: INTEGER, total :: INTEGER, timeTaken :: INTEGER, committedOperations :: INTEGER, failedOperations :: INTEGER, failedBatches :: INTEGER, retries :: INTEGER, errorMessages :: MAP, batch :: MAP, operations :: MAP, constraints :: LIST<STRING>, indexes :: LIST<STRING>)
name: apoc.refactor.rename.type
description:
Renames all `RELATIONSHIP` values with type `oldType` to `newType`.
If a `LIST<RELATIONSHIP>` is provided, the renaming is applied to the `RELATIONSHIP` values within this `LIST<RELATIONSHIP>` only.

returnDescription.name: batches
returnDescription.description: The number of batches the operation was run in.

returnDescription.name: total
returnDescription.description: The total number of renamings performed.

returnDescription.name: timeTaken
returnDescription.description: The time taken to complete the operation.

returnDescription.name: committedOperations
returnDescription.description: The total number of committed operations.

returnDescription.name: failedOperations
returnDescription.description: The total number of failed operations.

returnDescription.name: failedBatches
returnDescription.description: The total number of failed batches.

returnDescription.name: batch
operations
constraints
returnDescription.description: Constraints associated with the given label or type.

returnDescription.name: indexes
returnDescription.description: Indexes associated with the given label or type.

argumentDescription.name: oldType
argumentDescription.description: The type to rename.

argumentDescription.name: newType
argumentDescription.description: The new type for the relationship.

argumentDescription.name: rels
argumentDescription.description: The relationships to apply the new name to. If this list is empty, all relationships with the old type will be renamed.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description:
{
    batchSize = 100000 :: INTEGER,
    concurrency :: INTEGER,
    retries = 0 :: INTEGER,
    parallel = true :: BOOLEAN,
    batchMode = "BATCH" :: STRING
}

signature: apoc.refactor.setType(rel :: RELATIONSHIP, newType :: STRING) :: (input :: INTEGER, output :: RELATIONSHIP, error :: STRING)
name: apoc.refactor.setType
description: Changes the type of the given `RELATIONSHIP`.

returnDescription.name: input
returnDescription.description: The id of the given relationship.

returnDescription.name: output
returnDescription.description: The id of the new relationship with the updated type.

returnDescription.name: error
returnDescription.description: The message if an error occurred.

argumentDescription.name: rel
argumentDescription.description: The relationship to change the type of.

argumentDescription.name: newType
argumentDescription.description: The new type for the relationship.

signature: apoc.trigger.add(name :: STRING, statement :: STRING, selector :: MAP, config = {} :: MAP) :: (name :: STRING, query :: STRING, selector :: MAP, params :: MAP, installed :: BOOLEAN, paused :: BOOLEAN)
name: apoc.trigger.add
description:
Adds a trigger to the given Cypher statement.
The selector for this procedure is {phase:'before/after/rollback/afterAsync'}.

returnDescription.name: query
returnDescription.description: The query belonging to the trigger.

returnDescription.name: params
returnDescription.description: The parameters for the given Cypher statement.

returnDescription.name: installed
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the trigger was installed.

returnDescription.name: paused
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the trigger was paused.

argumentDescription.name: name
argumentDescription.description: The name of the trigger to add.

argumentDescription.name: statement
argumentDescription.description: The query to run when triggered.

argumentDescription.name: selector
argumentDescription.description: { phase = "before" :: ["before", "rollback", "after", "afterAsync"] }

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: The parameters for the given Cypher statement.

signature: apoc.trigger.pause(name :: STRING) :: (name :: STRING, query :: STRING, selector :: MAP, params :: MAP, installed :: BOOLEAN, paused :: BOOLEAN)
name: apoc.trigger.pause
description: Pauses the given trigger.

returnDescription.name: query
returnDescription.description: The query belonging to the trigger.

returnDescription.name: params
returnDescription.description: The parameters for the given Cypher statement.

returnDescription.name: installed
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the trigger was installed.

returnDescription.name: paused
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the trigger was paused.

argumentDescription.name: name
argumentDescription.description: The name of the trigger to pause.

signature: apoc.trigger.remove(name :: STRING) :: (name :: STRING, query :: STRING, selector :: MAP, params :: MAP, installed :: BOOLEAN, paused :: BOOLEAN)
name: apoc.trigger.remove

returnDescription.name: query
returnDescription.description: The query belonging to the trigger.

returnDescription.name: params
returnDescription.description: The parameters for the given Cypher statement.

returnDescription.name: paused
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the trigger was paused.

argumentDescription.name: name
argumentDescription.description: The name of the trigger to drop.

signature: apoc.trigger.removeAll() :: (name :: STRING, query :: STRING, selector :: MAP, params :: MAP, installed :: BOOLEAN, paused :: BOOLEAN)
name: apoc.trigger.removeAll
description: Removes all previously added triggers.

returnDescription.name: query
returnDescription.description: The query belonging to the trigger.

returnDescription.name: params
returnDescription.description: The parameters for the given Cypher statement.

returnDescription.description: Whether or not the trigger was paused.

signature: apoc.trigger.resume(name :: STRING) :: (name :: STRING, query :: STRING, selector :: MAP, params :: MAP, installed :: BOOLEAN, paused :: BOOLEAN)
name: apoc.trigger.resume
description: Resumes the given paused trigger.

returnDescription.name: query
returnDescription.description: The query belonging to the trigger.

returnDescription.name: params
returnDescription.description: The parameters for the given Cypher statement.

returnDescription.name: installed
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the trigger was installed.

returnDescription.name: paused
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the trigger was paused.

argumentDescription.name: name
argumentDescription.description: The name of the trigger to resume.

signature: apoc.warmup.run(loadProperties = false :: BOOLEAN, loadDynamicProperties = false :: BOOLEAN, loadIndexes = false :: BOOLEAN) :: (pageSize :: INTEGER, totalTime :: INTEGER, transactionWasTerminated :: BOOLEAN, nodesPerPage :: INTEGER, nodesTotal :: INTEGER, nodePages :: INTEGER, nodesTime :: INTEGER, relsPerPage :: INTEGER, relsTotal :: INTEGER, relPages :: INTEGER, relsTime :: INTEGER, relGroupsPerPage :: INTEGER, relGroupsTotal :: INTEGER, relGroupPages :: INTEGER, relGroupsTime :: INTEGER, propertiesLoaded :: BOOLEAN, dynamicPropertiesLoaded :: BOOLEAN, propsPerPage :: INTEGER, propRecordsTotal :: INTEGER, propPages :: INTEGER, propsTime :: INTEGER, stringPropsPerPage :: INTEGER, stringPropRecordsTotal :: INTEGER, stringPropPages :: INTEGER, stringPropsTime :: INTEGER, arrayPropsPerPage :: INTEGER, arrayPropRecordsTotal :: INTEGER, arrayPropPages :: INTEGER, arrayPropsTime :: INTEGER, indexesLoaded :: BOOLEAN, indexPages :: INTEGER, indexTime :: INTEGER)
name: apoc.warmup.run
description: Loads all `NODE` and `RELATIONSHIP` values in the database into memory.
deprecatedBy: Firstly, the procedure duplicates functionality of page cache warm up which is a part of the DBMS. Secondly, the API of this procedure is very specific to Record storage engine.

argumentDescription.description: loadProperties = false :: BOOLEAN

signature: apoc.when(condition :: BOOLEAN, ifQuery :: STRING, elseQuery =  :: STRING, params = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.when
description: This procedure will run the read-only `ifQuery` if the conditional has evaluated to true, otherwise the `elseQuery` will run.

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: The result returned from the evaluated Cypher query.

argumentDescription.name: condition
argumentDescription.description: The predicate deciding if to run the `ifQuery`or not.

argumentDescription.name: ifQuery
argumentDescription.description: The Cypher statement to run if the condition is true.

argumentDescription.name: elseQuery
argumentDescription.description: The Cypher statement to run if the condition is false.

argumentDescription.name: params
argumentDescription.description: The parameters for the given Cypher statement.
